newsitem.title: INDIA: Mother Teresa has peaceful night.
newsitem.headline: Mother Teresa has peaceful night.

text.p: Mother Teresa, recovering from life-saving heart surgery, had a peaceful night in intensive care and her condition was unchanged, a hospital official said on Wednesday.
"Mother Teresa had a good sleep," said S.K. Tiwari, administrator of Calcutta's B.M. Birla Heart Research Centre, where Mother Teresa was being treated.
"Her condition remains unchanged," he told Reuters.
The 86-year-old Roman Catholic nun has been suffering from an irregular heartbeat, bronchial pneumonia and weak kidneys.
She had surgery last week to clear two blocked arteries and had appeared to be recovering when longstanding kidney and lung problems resurfaced.
Doctors said on Tuesday they were optimistic the nun would recover, but cautioned that she remained in critical condition and was still not out of danger.
They said she could take a long time to recover, and might never be as active as before.
The nun, who was fitted with a heart pacemaker in 1989, had her first heart operation in the United States in 1991 and her second at the Birla centre in 1993.
